intro: Dicoma anomala subsp. gerrardii, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and small, star-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright orange, berry-like fruits that are edible and often used in culinary applications. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Dicoma anomala subsp. gerrardii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
